intro: Osbeckia dolichophylla, commonly known as the long-leaf osbeckia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that can reach up to 15 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, blooming during the spring and early summer. Osbeckia dolichophylla is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
